body:
Hi Matt,
Can you please attach this patch as a Jira issue. Although its really great to see folks using the github mirror, we use the ASF Nutch Jira instance [0] as our prima protocol for any Nutch related development.
The patch looks great
Thanks
Lewis

[0] https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NUTCH

Hi Lewis,

Sorry about that. It was just easier for me to submit the pull request while I was in JIRA and then follow up with the official location later. I've created a ticket in JIRA here: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NUTCH-1468

Thanks,
Matt

Hi @ysc thanks for the contribution. 
You can close this PR as we can now track it over at
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NUTCH-1736
Thanks

Hi @Meabed I look at the patch, It looks like it does not include the content for the Solr schema.xml.
Can you possibly modify the PR to include this?
Thank you. I will work to get this in to the codebase. Thanks
Thanks committed! @renxiawang
Hi @Meabed ping, do you have a chance to add the Solr schema.xml mods? Thanks!! Looking forward to this.

Yes updated :), please have a look at it.
Thanks
@renxiawang can you provide Javadoc for some of the new classes and issues your trying to include? This looks pretty solid apart from that.

Can you please take a look at the formatting style for Nutch code ?

On Tuesday, March 31, 2015, Sujen Shah notifications@github.com wrote:

> API calls documented at - https://wiki.apache.org/nutch/Nutch_1.X_RESTAPI.
> This pull request includes Index, Generate, Fetch, Parse, Update,
> 
> ## InvertLinks, Dedup and Readdb jobs.
> 
> You can view, comment on, or merge this pull request online at:
> 
>   https://github.com/apache/nutch/pull/16
> Commit Summary
> - Created NutchSever.java
> - Added cmd line option to start NutchServer on user specified port
> - Added JobInfo Response object
> - Added Configuration end point
> - Update ivy.xml
> - Request response objects for Configuration support
> - Merge branch 'NUTCH-1931' of https://github.com/sujen1412/nutch into
>   NUTCH-1931
> - APache CXF dependency
> - Added jaxrs dependency
> - Removed custom providers
> - Added JobResource
> - Added AbstractResource
> - Added JobManager
> - Added http-jetty dependency
> - Added "server" option to start NutchServer
> - Renaming command to startserver
> - Added Apache license
> - Added Apache license
> - Added Apache license
> - Added Apache license
> - Added Apache license
> - Renamed command to start NutchServer in bin/nutch
> - Start on custom port via -port option
> - Added command line option -help
> - Created Nutch tool and implemented in Injector
> - Instantiated JobManager object
> - Added new metadata from REST service
> - Job Enpoint and supporting classes
> - Changed arguments to Map<String, String> for tool
> - Classes for the job endpoint
> - Changed the result arg to Map<String, Object>
> - Added DbResource for running readdb
> - Added support for dump, url options in readdb
> - Corrected the -dir | segments option
> - Added License info
> - Added constructor
> - Removed commented lines
> - Corrected indentation
> - Corrected constructor call
> - Corrected required number of args
> - Corrected args for dir and <seg> <seg>
> 
> File Changes
> - _M_ ivy/ivy.xml
>   https://github.com/apache/nutch/pull/16/files#diff-0 (8)
> - _M_ src/bin/nutch
>   https://github.com/apache/nutch/pull/16/files#diff-1 (3)
> - _M_ src/java/org/apache/nutch/crawl/CrawlDb.java
>   https://github.com/apache/nutch/pull/16/files#diff-2 (61)
> - _M_ src/java/org/apache/nutch/crawl/CrawlDbReader.java
>   https://github.com/apache/nutch/pull/16/files#diff-3 (256)
> - _M_ src/java/org/apache/nutch/crawl/DeduplicationJob.java
>   https://github.com/apache/nutch/pull/16/files#diff-4 (19)
> - _M_ src/java/org/apache/nutch/crawl/Generator.java

>   https://github.com/apache/nutch/pull/16/files#diff-6 (24)
> - _M_ src/java/org/apache/nutch/crawl/LinkDb.java
>   https://github.com/apache/nutch/pull/16/files#diff-7 (54)
> - _M_ src/java/org/apache/nutch/fetcher/Fetcher.java
>   https://github.com/apache/nutch/pull/16/files#diff-8 (41)
> - _M_ src/java/org/apache/nutch/metadata/Nutch.java
>   https://github.com/apache/nutch/pull/16/files#diff-9 (66)
> - _M_ src/java/org/apache/nutch/parse/ParseSegment.java

> - _A_ src/java/org/apache/nutch/service/ConfManager.java

## 

_Lewis_

A small improvement would be to make t explicit which sub directory was
absent.

## 

_Lewis_
Shall I use this - http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/nutch/branches/2.x/eclipse-codeformat.xml ?

Please thank you very much Sujen. Great work this is going very well.
I'll test out ASAP and make best efforts to drive towards a commit on the
Backport f the REST API. This is grand.

On Tuesday, March 31, 2015, Sujen Shah notifications@github.com wrote:

## 

_Lewis_

I am just finishing writing a tutorial on how to run the jobs, on the wiki. The current documentation just gives an example with placeholder arguments. 
Will post link as soon as I am done.

Ack good job

## 

_Lewis_
Here is the link - https://wiki.apache.org/nutch/Nutch_1.X_RESTAPI/RunningJobsTutorial
Corrected formatting to conform with Nutch code formatting style
Hey Sujen, this patch doesn't apply cleanly to Nutch there are merge conflicts. Can you please correct them and open up a new PR?
Yes will do it.
ping @sujen1412 can you please update the PR?
thanks @Meabed I went ahead and committed this! Thanks!
Yes, apologies for the delay will do it by today evening.
Updated, and resolved merge conflicts.
@MJJoyce see comments from Seb on NUTCH-1987
@sujen1412 this doesn't apply cleanly can you see my comments on the JIRA?
Yes, saw them. I'm working on cleaning the patch.
Thanks @sujen1412 let me know when it's ready
@sujen1412 did you complete this?

So I pulled out the missing files:

[usc-secure-wireless-061-034:~/tmp/nutch-1.10-trunk] mattmann% svn commit -m "Remainder of fix for NUTCH-1973: Job Administration end point for the REST service contributed by Sujen Shah sujen1412@gmail.com"
Adding         src/java/org/apache/nutch/service/model/request/JobConfig.java
Adding         src/java/org/apache/nutch/util/NutchTool.java
Transmitting file data ..
Committed revision 1675249.
[usc-secure-wireless-061-034:~/tmp/nutch-1.10-trunk] mattmann%
@isAbird  - not sure what this PR is intended to do? Can you please explain it?
I have no idea I think it is spam :(
Updated the files
thanks @sujen1412 will look to commit
ok closed it - thanks @lewismc
@sebastian-nagel FYI, thoughts on this?
@sujen1412 where are we at cc @lewismc
ping @sujen1412 Asitang @lewismc any progress here?
Updated PR, please have a look.
this LGTM, @sujen1412 - @sebastian-nagel can you take a look?

@sujen1412 I am seeing this:

```
    [javac] Compiling 204 source files to <https://builds.apache.org/job/Nutch-trunk/ws/trunk/build/classes>
    [javac] <https://builds.apache.org/job/Nutch-trunk/ws/trunk/src/java/org/apache/nutch/service/resources/AdminResource.java>:26: error: cannot find symbol
    [javac] import org.apache.nutch.service.model.response.NutchServerInfo;
    [javac]                                               ^
    [javac]   symbol:   class NutchServerInfo
    [javac]   location: package org.apache.nutch.service.model.response
    [javac] <https://builds.apache.org/job/Nutch-trunk/ws/trunk/src/java/org/apache/nutch/service/resources/AdminResource.java>:39: error: cannot find symbol
    [javac]   public NutchServerInfo getServerStatus(){
    [javac]          ^
    [javac]   symbol:   class NutchServerInfo
    [javac]   location: class AdminResource
    [javac] <https://builds.apache.org/job/Nutch-trunk/ws/trunk/src/java/org/apache/nutch/service/resources/AdminResource.java>:40: error: cannot find symbol
    [javac]     NutchServerInfo serverInfo = new NutchServerInfo();
    [javac]     ^
    [javac]   symbol:   class NutchServerInfo
    [javac]   location: class AdminResource
    [javac] <https://builds.apache.org/job/Nutch-trunk/ws/trunk/src/java/org/apache/nutch/service/resources/AdminResource.java>:40: error: cannot find symbol
    [javac]     NutchServerInfo serverInfo = new NutchServerInfo();
    [javac]                                      ^
    [javac]   symbol:   class NutchServerInfo
    [javac]   location: class AdminResource
    [javac] Note: <https://builds.apache.org/job/Nutch-trunk/ws/trunk/src/java/org/apache/nutch/crawl/CrawlDbReader.java> uses unchecked or unsafe operations.
    [javac] Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
    [javac] 4 errors
```

Looks like you forgot to add NutchServerInfo. Can you please add it?
@asitang did you forget to attach SeedResource?
Hi @asitang, just saw the code and I think the you will need to format the code according to http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/nutch/branches/2.x/eclipse-codeformat.xml
Great work @sujen1412 I'm going to take a look at this right now. Can you take some time update: https://wiki.apache.org/nutch/Nutch_1.X_RESTAPI I think it's a bit out of date?
Yes, will get the wiki up-to date with the new developments.
overall looks good! Just need to implement the other methods and check out my comments.
Pulled
sorry for the mess reopened a new one
hi @asitang please see my comments
WOW @asitang this is LEGIT! Great work. My comments are really aesthetic more than anything. I am +1 to commit this once that is addressed.
+1 from me. I think renaming it to parserfilter-naivebayes would be fine and shorten it. Either way I am +1.
THanks looks great!
will commit @asitang

I see the following failures with this PR:

```
[mattmann-0420740:~/tmp/nutch-trunk] mattmann% more build/index-static/test/TEST-org.apache.nutch.indexer.staticfield.TestStaticFieldIndexerTest.txt 
Testsuite: org.apache.nutch.indexer.staticfield.TestStaticFieldIndexerTest
Tests run: 3, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 1.085 sec

Testcase: testNormalScenario took 0.444 sec
Testcase: testCustomDelimiters took 0.364 sec
        FAILED
test if doc has field1
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: test if doc has field1
        at org.apache.nutch.indexer.staticfield.TestStaticFieldIndexerTest.testCustomDelimiters(TestStaticFieldIndexerTest.java:149)

Testcase: testEmptyIndexStatic took 0.126 sec
[mattmann-0420740:~/tmp/nutch-trunk] mattmann% 
```

Also to apply it I had to do the following (due to extraneous commits included from lewismc) - please git reset --hard HEAD before updating and pushing your PR.

```
git apply --exclude="*CHANGES.txt" --exclude="*NOTICE.txt" --exclude="*nutch-default.xml" --exclude="*default.properties" < 43.patch
```
FYI @PeterCiuffetti

Hello Chris...

Thanks for looking at my PR.  Sorry about the unit test failure.  Ive addressed this and added another test case to cover checking delimiters that need regex escaping.

To make applying the patch simple, can you clarify what needs to be done here?   Are you suggesting I remove this PR, apply my changes on a fresh clone of the trunk and do a new pull request on that?   Or is there a set of steps I can do to resolve it in this PR?

Yep just submitting an updated branch to this pr would be great thanks

Ok, heres the steps I did... does this cover it?

```
git checkout NUTCH-2052
git pull origin trunk
git reset --hard HEAD
[fixed the unit test failures]
git commit -a -m"Escapng regexp chars when used as delimiters"
[fixed a code formatting issue]
git commit -a -m"Formatting change"
git push -u git@github.com:PeterCiuffetti/nutch.git NUTCH-2052
```
Yep! Will commit shortly

Hey @PeterCiuffetti there is a randomly occurring test error here:

```
    [junit] Tests run: 7, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 64.156 sec
    [junit] Test org.apache.nutch.protocol.httpclient.TestProtocolHttpClient FAILED
```

Thoughts?

I'd be happy to investigate..  Im not able to repeat it though.  Is this happening on Jenkins? on the trunk?  Can you paste the TEST-org.apache.nutch.protocol.httpclient.TestProtocolHttpClient.txt with the error?

While the test passes for me, I am noticing that it logs several copies of this exception:

```
java.lang.IllegalStateException: STREAM
        at org.mortbay.jetty.Response.getWriter(Response.java:616)
```

Which suggest something not right in the jsp's being used.
yeah i'm getting that same error. The first time it failed for me, then it passed. I can't see the builds.apache.org jenkins output, but I can try testing again. Let me try that. @PeterCiuffetti

I can make the exceptions go away if I adjust the JSPs.  This is an artifact of white space outside the code blocks.  Eg.

```
--%>
<%--
```

...which you will find in scattered places in the JSP like here: https://github.com/apache/nutch/blob/trunk/src/plugin/protocol-httpclient/jsp/basic.jsp#L15, needs to become...

```
--%><%--
```

This prevents the response writer from being unnecessarily invoked on a page that may decide (later) to do a redirect (https://github.com/apache/nutch/blob/trunk/src/plugin/protocol-httpclient/jsp/basic.jsp#L65).  What jetty is complaining about is that the response is already in flight at the point where the page decides to send some headers.

So while this is easy to fix (remove all unnecessary white space outside code blocks) Im not sure if this is the smoking gun.

I've quite flamboyantly added the configuration key "http.min.render", which is described as the minimum render time before the plugin returns a html body, in milliseconds. I added this because the goal of getting the rendered links and content might sometime take longer than expected, and also because there's no time period specified before fetching otherwise(it does feel like you risk just getting the exact same non-rendered body).

This does not affect the fetcher.server.delay, as that timer seems to start after completion.
